page.title: 17British Rail, Peterborough
page.content: Peterborough is a major junction, with the London to Scotland main line crossing the Birmingham/East Anglia route. The trains on the main line run at speeds of up to 125 mph and travel between London and Edinburgh in 4\ hours. The last five years have seen a huge growth in commuter travel and no other city has as many fast trains to London travelling a comparable distance. By 1987 the line from London to Peterborough will be electrified. Like elsewhere in the country, there is a close tie between the Post Office and British Rail with one of the largest depots for the carrying of Post Office parcels. There is little originating freight traffic, the largest customer being Ketton Cement who forward twenty-five wagons each day.
